summary: Didn’t Aerys remove Rhaeger from the line of succession? Aerys named Viserys his heir. Viserys was crowned king of the seven...
body: Didn’t Aerys remove Rhaeger from the line of succession? Aerys named Viserys his heir. Viserys was crowned king of the seven kingdoms and he in turn named Daenerys his heir. Aerys and Viserys are dead and Rhaeger (and subsequently his children) were removed from the line of succession. So isn’t Daenerys still the heir? Jon may have a claim on it, but doesn’t Daenerys have a stronger claim?

reblog.comment: Didn’t Aerys remove Rhaeger from the line of succession? Aerys named Viserys his heir. Viserys was crowned king of the seven kingdoms and he in turn named Daenerys his heir. blog.name: waking-dreams-of-harmony
blog.title: Headcanon is the new reality...
blog.description:
Hi there! My name is Ellie! Welcome to my tumblr!  Just thought I'd add a few things to know about me and my blog! If my url gives you any clues, at the heart of this tumblr, I'm a proud Harmony shipper through and through. And while I do still reblog HHR and Dan and Emma content (and I always will) you will find that the majority of my focus has shifted to Jonerys (Jon x Daenerys from Game of Thrones). And while you might have to do a little deep blogging to find my reblogs on these, I also ship--both passionately and casually--Cesare x Lucrezia, Mulder x Scully, Lizzington for a while until tptb started to mess with it, Baker x Lawson (Bawson), all the Sense8 ships though Kalagang is my #1, Clint x Natasha (Clintasha), Jane x Thor (Fosterson), Darcy x Loki (Tasertricks), Darcy x Steve (Shieldshock), Kili x Tauriel (Kiliel), Superman x Wonder Woman (Superwonder), and more than I have space for or the memory to list. 
I do my best to tag every post so that if something is your notp, it's nsfw, or it's triggering, you can blacklist it. That said, if you follow me and there is something that you need tagged in order to make it a happy place for you to explore, come into my inbox and let me know :) You will also see a lot of politically charged reblogs in support of women, the queer/gender-queer and trans community, BLM, Muslims, POC, Jewish people, the mentally ill, and austistic people. I'm strongly pro choice, pro inter-sectional feminism, and refuse to call the angry cheeto currently living in the white house president. If anything like that offends you, this might not be the right blog for you.
Last little few things to throw out there: I'm 35, I plan to adopt at least 4 cats (or more) at some point and be that cat lady everyone's always whispering about, and I tend to greet and converse with everyone I meet like an overeager puppy. 
Whew! Sorry for the long intro folks! Please enjoy your time here, and remember, you're always welcome to come in and say hi!

tags: this is where the dead walk
summary: Fear cuts deeper than swords, the quiet voice inside her whispered. Suddenly Arya remembered the crypts at Winterfell. They were...
body:
Fear cuts deeper than swords, the quiet voice inside her whispered. Suddenly Arya remembered the crypts at Winterfell. They were a lot scarier than this place, she told herself. She’d been just a little girl the first time she saw them. Her brother Robb had taken them down, her and Sansa and baby Bran, who’d been no bigger than Rickon was now. They’d only had one candle between them, and Bran’s eyes had gotten as big as saucers as he stared at the stone faces of the Kings of Winter, with their wolves at their feet and their iron swords across their laps.

Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. Baby Bran had clutched at Arya’s hand.

When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Arya stood her ground and gave the spirit a punch. It was only Jon, covered with flour. “You stupid,” she told him, “you scared the baby,” but Jon and Robb just laughed and laughed, and pretty soon Bran and Arya were laughing too.

— AGOT, Arya IV

When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. Fear cuts deeper than swords, the quiet voice inside her whispered. Suddenly Arya remembered the crypts at Winterfell. They were a lot scarier than this place, she told herself. She’d been just a little girl the first time she saw them. Her brother Robb had taken them down, her and Sansa and baby Bran, who’d been no bigger than Rickon was now. They’d only had one candle between them, and Bran’s eyes had gotten as big as saucers as he stared at the stone faces of the Kings of Winter, with their wolves at their feet and their iron swords across their laps.

Robb took them all the way down to the end, past Grandfather and Brandon and Lyanna, to show them their own tombs. Sansa kept looking at the stubby little candle, anxious that it might go out. Old Nan had told her there were spiders down here, and rats as big as dogs. Robb smiled when she said that. “There are worse things than spiders and rats,” he whispered. “This is where the dead walk.” That was when they heard the sound, low and deep and shivery. Baby Bran had clutched at Arya’s hand.

When the spirit stepped out of the open tomb, pale white and moaning for blood, Sansa ran shrieking for the stairs, and Bran wrapped himself around Robb’s leg, sobbing. blog.name: jonsnowsource
blog.title: there's no shame in fear
blog.description:
Blog dedicated to Jon Snow
We track: #gotjonsnow #jonsnowsource #jonsnowedit

body:
Thoughts about GoT 8x02

Loved that Brienne stood up for Jaime

I am really happy that Sansa trusts Brienne so much and accepted Jaime(kind of)

Not only that but Sansa is damn smart. When Daenerys went to her to talk and then they laughed a bit about the men but then Sansa asked the true questions “what about the north”

The little reunion scene of Jaime and Tyrion

*Tormund*

The group chat infrint if the fire

Brienne and Jaime

Brienne finally becoming a knight, she truly deserves it

*Tormund*

Sansa and Theon reunion

I think Arya’s and Gendrys love scene was really in character for them and I wouldn’t have it any other way

The song Podrick sang reminded me of Pippins song in Lord of the Rings and I really loved it

Lady Mormont and Jorah Mormont talking

The little girl that wanted to fight was really amazing

*Tormund and Sansa*

All in all I really liked that episode and even if nothing “really” happened it was quite nice regarding that I will probably cry next episode.

✿Buffy, Angel, Doctor Who (mostly RTD era), Warehouse 13. Clexa. SQ♕.✿ And scenes I liked from various TV shows (comedies, mostly Friends, but also ➽Arrow, Orphan Black, Supergirl, Game of Thrones ۩, Legends of Tomorrow, The Walking Dead, The Punisher, Jessica Jones, Faking It, OITNB).

I always tag everything...

✰Word to the wise, if you are looking for a pairing, search with an "x" inbetween the characters' names, not by its "ship" name.

⚔My thoughts/opinions/reviews/text posts are tagged as "My Musings"⚔.

tags: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
(Jesus why is s8 making me make posts that I'm tagging as ''anti-'' to be safe when I'm not really against Daenerys??)
summary: “If it were true, it would make you the last male heir of house Targaryen. You’d have claim to the Iron Throne.“ Right, valid...
body:
“If it were true, it would make you the last male heir of house Targaryen. You’d have claim to the Iron Throne.“

Right, valid “argument” that proves the improbability of it being true, Dany. o_0 You don’t want it to be true, because of exactly that and it posing a threat to your claim, so deem it “impossible” and “if it WERE true”, not “if it’s true”. 🙄

Ps. I love how both Jon & her thought of that instead of the incest. By “love” I mean I hate it.
Ps2. Clarke’s acting was great! 👍

tags: i really dont want them to make this whole thing into a fight between them but im starting to get the feeling that that is how it is going
to devolve into and i really really dont like it
i mean... danny's reaction was very belivable i dont understand why people take such issue with it. she was shocked
that little breath that left her - hte shock
the surprise of it all and the disbelief were all so real to me
i mean she has been alone for so so long. she has loved sure but she has never really had family i guess
and YEAH i know that's gross and all but we all know theyre in love so im ignoring taht factor for now. its a story. whatever. that aisde
i really think that given a littel time she would actually be happy that he is alive and who he says he is i guess. but its also completely
legit and RIGHT that her first reaction would be the whole - birthright and throne thing. i mean cmon - this has been drummed itno her since
she was a kid. this has been her mission. her goal. she has killed for it
bled for it. she has steeled ehrself for it. she has been LONELY for it - hoping that she would take that throne and finally make a home and
make her family proud. its all she knwos. and now this dude comes along and says he was born from the right sperm and that gives him abetter
claim than hers ????? to something she ahs been fighting for all ehr life and that he has never wanted anyway????? i GET why her mind went
there. its not like she is not sorrounded by people who would chose jon in a hearbeat over her.
summary: Jon has been distant with Danny throughout the episode - so it really must have taken quite some courage - and a sacrifice of...
body: Jon has been distant with Danny throughout the episode - so it really must have taken quite some courage - and a sacrifice of pride - and not to mention a lot of trust in her feelings (and faith in his), for her to approach him in the crypts. these scenes between them these past two episodes are actually what are making me start to warm up to them in the show - she more vulnerable around him than around any other character; looks a lot more like she was in earlier seasons. u know, more like a person than a queen, i guess. idk, it makes it all believable. certainly more so than the way they were last season.

blog.name: greedy-little-thing
blog.title: For All The Needy Girls
blog.description: My thoughts, books I love, and other things that destroy me

summary: You know what I love about Game of Thrones: how characters develop and no one is solely good at all times or bad at all times....
body: You know what I love about Game of Thrones: how characters develop and no one is solely good at all times or bad at all times. For example, Jaime starts off as a bad guy but now has redeemed himself to someone good. Even more surprising is that Danny was once good and is now descending into the path of darkness and tyranny. It just goes to show that as humans we are multifaceted and can change given any major event and I love how GOT portrays and stays true to the human nature of it all!

reblog.comment: You know what I love about Game of Thrones: how characters develop and no one is solely good at all times or bad at all times. It just goes to show that as humans we are multifaceted and can change given any major event and I love how GOT portrays and stays true to the human nature of it all!
